Overwhelming slay-power.

Which is to say, she's talented, brilliant, incredible, amazing, show stopping, spectacular, never the same, totally unique, completely not ever been done before, unafraid to reference or not reference, put it in a blender, shit on it, vomit on it, eat it, give birth to it. And has immense damage potential, babe.

Why, just last night, I was defending on Midtown 2nd point that little room overlooking the tunnel (the one Widows like to hide in). Anticipating our enemy Widow would set up within, I set up my glamourous turrets. And when my sanctum-parlour was breached by not one or two, but three enemy squishies? Brig, Weaver and Sombra were smote by my dazzling intellect. Exodia Obliterated within 5 seconds of one another by my hand, and no other's.

To dislodge me from my throne was sent Reinhardt. He did not succeed, for in my mind I had forseen this, and a quick flick later I had traversed a great distance to safety, across the street onto the bridge. He stood in bewilderment at his wasted time, and fought within his own mind to stay there and deny me return, or leave and admit his folly. Later on, my mega-zesty laser would penetrate both his nano-boosted armour and pride.

I love the satisfaction brought on my strutting in on snipers through my Teleporter, my arrival styling so hard on the likes of Ashe, Ana and Widow that they spontaneously melt. Or devilishly incanting "[Bye bitch](https://www.instagram.com/lizzobeeating/p/CHTNoFvB6VN/?hl=en)" as I effortlessly escape unscratched through a preplaced portal. 

Moveover, who has a statement piece as statesful as Photon Barrier? The ability to deny so much of an enemy's hard work, as if a counterspell by magic. 

She is a flanker, frontliner, assassin, anti-sniper, ult-stopping Queen.

Blizzard needs to stop penny pinching as much as they've been. I get it, they exist to make money bla bla but return on investment is a real thing.

Fuck layoffs, hire a lot of people. Get more artists since that's the department that has suffered the most, there's been so much filler and recycled crap in the BP and shop, it's insane. Get enough artists to create original cosmetics and to make proper cinematics like we used to have. I get it, a cinematic is insanely expensive to produce, but you will see that investment come back because....

You NEED to bring back the lore. Plenty of non-gamers got into overwatch because of the immense lore and masterful worldbuilding. Nowadays there is a fraction of that. It all used to flow together, now it's more along the lines of "heres Venture they do the diggy", "heres Juno she's actually from space", the differences between the backstories of OW1 characters and OW2 characters are insane. I know that the lore hasn't stopped completely, we still get backstories and little lore bits. But it's nothing like what OW1 had, in OW1 everything fit together like an ever-expanding jigsaw puzzle. It seems they might be trying to get back into deeper lore stuff with Phreak, a character that seems to have very close ties to OW1 stuff, but I don't want to speak too soon. Do you remember the last time we had a hero that really mattered to the lore? Imo, it was Ramattra, almost 2 whole years ago.

More free cosmetics. I get it, the game copied fortnite's model now so skins have to be $20 and we need battle passes and constant crossover skins. But surely it wouldn't hurt to give more skins for free? It's NOT generous to give a single skin during a temporary event, hell, the skins they usually give out are genuine garbage! Tell me the last time you actually liked a skin they gave out for free during an event, it's not been in the last year that's for sure. And don't even get me started on the absolute dripfeed of legacy credits, we should be getting atleast 3 times as many of them, if not even more. Some of those cosmetics are 8 years old, it makes me really regret not grinding more OW1 for lootboxes. Hell, I think they should increase how many OW coins you get from the pass, you really should be getting atleast the cost of the pass back. I think charging for crossover skins is okay, OW1 had paid skins too like the OWL skins, Twitch sub skins, Blizzcon skins, Pink Mercy etc. But OW2 is out here taking OW1 lootbox skins, changing the colors slightly, and expecting us to shell out $20. Respect the customer Blizzard, or we will back out at any time. But I guess you'll just shove out more Kiriko slop, since that seems to sell well regardless...

TL;DR Blizzard please dump money into the game and everything around it, I promise it will pay back even if it will take some time to regain the trust. The people that loved it are still there, you just pushed them away through a series of unfortunate events lined up one after another that you yourself caused.

The real beauty of \*Overwatch\* is that it’s not just about fighting. Once you get to know the maps and heroes, everyone finds their own ways to use different routes to attack or escape. It’s not just everyone battling it out in one spot. When you’re up against a strong opponent, but you can keep the pressure on them by using your favorite hero, well-practiced skills, and your own routes to secure the win—that’s when you really start to love this game.

It's interesting how the game navigates the complexities of violence and morality. Omnics are portrayed as less than human, yet they serve as a canvas for the game's commentary on discrimination. The contradiction is striking. While the lore supports a more nuanced view, the gameplay choices ultimately reflect a desire to keep it kid-friendly. It's a telling reflection of how media often grapples with sensitive topics, using robots as a convenient shield against harsher realities.

There are players like me who would play tank a lot more if it was 2-2-2 again. I dislike solo tanking. Nothing in the game currently motivates me to queue for it anymore. It's miserable. I would 100% queue for tank again, consistently, if it was 6v6 with role queue. My longest queue times are for support currently. I can basically instaqueue into dps or have less than a 2 min queue for comp any time of the day. We got sick of lack of variety in the tank category ( there were 5 or 6 tanks for 2 people to choose from) shields, stuns and visual clutter in ow1. Nobody asked for 5v5. I don't know if you remember when it was announced, but nobody wanted it. It wasn't like it was this idea they floated around or something mentioned on social media by players, etc. They basically just announced it and acted like it was the solution to our problems. We accepted it because we had PVE on the horizon so if the pvp sucked initially, it would be whatever.

They're gaslighting you into thinking 5v5 is better when all we really wanted was content and fixes to obvious issues.

OW doesn't have "casual roots". Can we stop joking around for one single second?

You wanna know what game had "casual roots"? TF2. For nearly 10 years, TF2 was a casual-only game. Sure, there were players who wanted to brag their skills and took the game seriously, but it was a meme-filled game with game modes so casual that you could freely swap sides in the middle of the game.

It was so casual that you could join and leave matches whenever you wanted with no penalty whatsoever. You could play whatever you want with no role restriction. You could spy crab around and no one gave a damn. That's what casual is.

It was only after Meet Your Match update in 2016 that TF2 developed any sense of competitive environment, but because of its "casual roots" the playerbase still argues to this day about friendlies vs tryhards.

Compare this to OW, which launched WITH competitive mode on day 1 and added nothing but growing list of restrictions to discourage casual play.

If QP was truly meant to be casual, why is QP also split into role queue vs open? Why is there a leaver penalty? Why can't you play multiple of same heroes? That's because it's not a casual mode. You can delude yourself all you want about what "casual" means, but clearly you don't even know the meaning of the word when there was a clear precedence of what a casual game actually looks like lmao.

>A death on defense is worth twice that of on attack.

Absolutely not true. It may have been the case if we still had 2CP with the death timer penalties, but in the current OW2, the attack/defense maps are all payload maps one way or another. By the nature of payload as a game mode, defense has an inherent advantage because

1. payload has to end up at defense's spawn, making deaths twice as costly to attack teams

2. attack teams are bound to the payload while defense has an option to fight in or outside of its vincinity.

Was mercenary stacking taken away in TF2? It was in competitive mode, so why not casual mode? Why can't OW do the same? Because OW isn't a casual game.

Was team size restriction put in place for TF2 casual? Absolutely not, but it exists in competitive. Why? Because one is clearly meant to be casual and another competitive.

Look at you and your mental gymnastics to make excuses for QP faithfully following in the footsteps of competitive changes and still going "hurr but it's meant to be casual".

I don't care what the underlying context is or whether that exonerates someone from blame or not. All I said is numbers are numbers and facts are facts. There will be situations when what appears on the surface was indeed a refraction of the truth underneath and sometimes not. But why are you creating all these hypothetical scenarios in your head about "what ifs" and "but in this case" etc?

If a soldier did 6k damage and widow did 15k, then the soldier didn't even do half the damage that widow did. That's the fact. Whether that leads to legitimate blame is a context that only people in-game will be the judge of and is none of my nor your concern.

I started sometime before the 2017 anniversary (I dont really remember but have the icon) through to 2021 before getting so infuriated that I broke my disc (lol) and quit "forever". 

Came back during OW2 anniversary, been having a blast. Overall I feel the game is infinitely more balanced and enjoyable, but in truth I do long for a lot of the jank of OW1. The hard counters were worse, CC was out of control and the game was a frequent source of anger, but the joy Id feel from games, when I did, was just as intense as the anger. The game now feels consistent, and because of that, less invigorating.
